intro: Echium humile var. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered common thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces tall, branched stems bearing clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its flowers are rich in nectar and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
